cards.name: Team Magma's Numel
cards.text: No matter how heavy the cargo, we can transport it to our destination with ease, thanks to Numel.

attacks.name: Ember
attacks.text: Discard an Energy attached to this Pokémon.

cards.name: Team Magma's Camerupt

abilities.name: Burning Draft
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may attach a Fighting or Fire Energy card from your discard pile to this Pokémon.

cards.text: Camerupt, with its strength against fire, played a big role in rescuing team members.

attacks.name: Flame Ball
attacks.text: Move a basic Energy from this Pokémon to 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

cards.name: Team Aqua's Spheal
cards.text: Spheal's Water Gun can put out any fire. Flames used by opponents have no effect!

cards.name: Team Aqua's Sealeo
cards.text: It provides support by making paths of ice. It can win any battle as long as it's on ice.

attacks.name: Splatter
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Hail Storm
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon is a Team Magma Pokémon, this attack does 60 more damage.

cards.name: Team Aqua's Walrein
cards.text: It's good at attacks that freeze opponents with a powerful cold snap. Then, it pulverizes a frozen foe with its sharp tusks!

attacks.name: Power Blow
attacks.text: This attack does 30 damage times the amount of Energy attached to this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Dual Blizzard
attacks.text: Discard 2 Water Energy attached to this Pokémon. This attack does 80 damage to 2 of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

cards.name: Team Aqua's Kyogre-EX

abilities.name: Power Saver
abilities.text: If there are 4 or fewer Team Aqua Pokémon in play, this Pokémon can't attack.

cards.text: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Aqua Impact
attacks.text: This attack does 20 more damage for each Colorless in your opponent's Active Pokémon's Retreat Cost.

cards.name: Team Aqua's Grimer
cards.text: Its flexible body, which allows it to squeeze into any cracks, comes in handy when invading enemy hideouts.

cards.name: Team Aqua's Muk

abilities.name: Sludge Festival
abilities.text: The Retreat Cost of each Pokémon in play (except for Team Aqua Pokémon) is Colorless more.

cards.text: It immobilizes its opponents by wrapping them in its huge, poisonous body. It'll smoosh you, too!

attacks.name: Pester
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon is affected by a Special Condition, this attack does 60 more damage.

cards.name: Team Aqua's Seviper
cards.text: Seviper's tail is a sharp blade. It can even poison you!

attacks.name: Venomous Fang
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned.

attacks.name: Venom Tail
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon is affected by a Special Condition, discard an Energy attached to that Pokémon.

cards.name: Team Magma's Baltoy
cards.text: They all cry out at once to let us know when they spot an enemy. It really helps out!

attacks.name: Telekinesis
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness or Resistance.

cards.name: Team Magma's Claydol

abilities.name: Magma Switch
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may move a basic Energy from 1 of your Pokémon to 1 of your Team Magma Pokémon.

cards.text: Claydol's beam can seize opponents and keep them from moving. Long-range attacks are its specialty!

cards.name: Team Magma's Aron
cards.text: Aron, which even devour metal, can eat and destroy enemy ships in an instant.

cards.name: Team Magma's Lairon
cards.text: When Lairon uses Take Down, the impact from its solid body is enough to destroy concrete!

attacks.name: Take Down
attacks.text: This Pokémon does 10 damage to itself.

cards.name: Team Magma's Aggron
cards.text: Aggron's metal horns can smash through any defenses, no matter how strong!

attacks.name: Rock Stomp
attacks.text: Discard as many Fighting Energy attached to your Pokémon as you like. This attack does 40 damage times the amount of Fighting Energy you discarded.

attacks.name: Boulder Storm
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon that has any damage counters on it. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

cards.name: Team Magma's Groudon-EX

abilities.name: Power Saver
abilities.text: If there are 4 or fewer Team Magma Pokémon in play, this Pokémon can't attack.

cards.text: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Magma Quake
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon already has any damage counters on it, this attack does 80 more damage.

cards.name: Team Aqua's Poochyena
cards.text: Poochyena can easily detect invading foes with its acute sense of smell. It's an excellent lookout!

attacks.name: Roar
attacks.text: Your opponent switches his or her Active Pokémon with 1 of his or her Benched Pokémon.

cards.name: Team Magma's Poochyena
cards.text: Poochyena's nose can identify any scent. It's very useful for reconnaissance.

attacks.name: Infiltrate
attacks.text: Your opponent reveals his or her hand.

cards.name: Team Aqua's Mightyena
cards.text: Thanks to Mightyena's outstanding leadership, it's very good at combination attacks that can leave a foe helpless.

attacks.name: Teampact
attacks.text: Flip a coin for each Team Aqua Pokémon you have in play. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Crunch
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard an Energy attached to your opponent's Active Pokémon.

cards.name: Team Magma's Mightyena
cards.text: This Pokémon is loyal to its master. It will protect its partner to the end, no matter what.

attacks.name: Hostile Fang
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon is a Team Aqua Pokémon, this attack does 40 more damage.

cards.name: Team Aqua's Carvanha
cards.text: You can't keep up with its movements underwater, can you? If you get caught in this whirlpool, there'll be no escape.

attacks.name: Fin Smack
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

cards.name: Team Aqua's Sharpedo

abilities.name: Aqua Search
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may search your deck for a Team Aqua Pokémon, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

cards.text: It boasts fangs so powerful that they knock opponents out in one shot! Enemies that slip up will be taken down without fail!

cards.name: Team Magma's Zangoose
cards.text: Can you handle the formation attack of the fearless Zangoose?

attacks.name: Call for Family
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 2 Basic Team Magma Pokémon and put them onto your Bench. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Team Play
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage times the number of Team Magma Pokémon on your Bench.

cards.name: Aqua Diffuser
cards.text: Attach a Pokémon Tool to 1 of your Pokémon that doesn't already have a Pokémon Tool attached to it.,The Team Aqua Pokémon this card is attached to can also use the attack on this card. (You still need the necessary Energy to use this attack.),You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

attacks.name: Aqua Diffuser
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused and Poisoned.

cards.name: Magma Pointer
cards.text: Attach a Pokémon Tool to 1 of your Pokémon that doesn't already have a Pokémon Tool attached to it.,The Team Magma Pokémon this card is attached to can also use the attack on this card. (You still need the necessary Energy to use this attack.),You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

attacks.name: Magma Pointer
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

cards.name: Team Aqua Admin
cards.text: Attach a basic Energy card from your discard pile to your Active Team Aqua Pokémon.,You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

cards.name: Team Aqua Grunt
cards.text: Discard a card from your hand. (If you can't discard a card, you can't play this card.) Draw 3 cards. If you discarded a Team Aqua Pokémon, draw 1 more card.,You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

cards.name: Team Aqua's Great Ball
cards.text: Search your deck for a Basic Team Aqua Pokémon and a basic Water Energy card, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.,You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

cards.name: Team Aqua's Secret Base
cards.text: The Retreat Cost of each Pokémon in play (except for Team Aqua Pokémon) is Colorless more.,This card stays in play when you play it. Discard this card if another Stadium card comes into play. If another card with the same name is in play, you can't play this card.

cards.name: Team Magma Admin
cards.text: Put up to 3 Team Magma Pokémon from your discard pile into your hand.,You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

cards.name: Team Magma Grunt
cards.text: Discard a card from your hand. (If you can't discard a card, you can't play this card.) Draw 3 cards. If you discarded a Team Magma Pokémon, draw 1 more card.,You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

cards.name: Team Magma's Great Ball
cards.text: Search your deck for a Basic Team Magma Pokémon and a basic Fighting Energy card, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.,You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

cards.name: Team Magma's Secret Base
cards.text: Whenever any player puts a Basic Pokémon (except for Team Magma Pokémon) from his or her hand onto his or her Bench, put 2 damage counters on that Pokémon.,This card stays in play when you play it. Discard this card if another Stadium card comes into play. If another card with the same name is in play, you can't play this card.

cards.name: Double Aqua Energy
cards.text: This card can only be attached to Team Aqua Pokémon. Discard this card at the end of the turn you attached it.,This card provides WaterWater Energy only while it is attached to a Team Aqua Pokémon.,(If this card is attached to anything other than a Team Aqua Pokémon, discard this card.)

cards.name: Double Magma Energy
cards.text: This card can only be attached to Team Magma Pokémon. Discard this card at the end of the turn you attached it.,This card provides FightingFighting Energy only while it is attached to a Team Magma Pokémon.,(If this card is attached to anything other than a Team Magma Pokémon, discard this card.)
